definition: to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: I lifted my right hand and made scissoring movements with my first two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我抬起右手，用食指和中指做了几个剪东西的动作。

sentences.english: But, uplifting my eyes, I saw that Berenice stood before me.
sentences.chinese: 可当我抬起眼睛，我看见贝蕾妮丝站在我跟前。

sentences.english: My head was rising up, and my body was following it.
sentences.chinese: 我抬起头，身体也随之立起。

sentences.english: The injured man levered himself up on his elbow.
sentences.chinese: 受伤者靠肘部费劲地抬起身子。

sentences.english: Dyco's Easy Loader is designed to easily lift and load Plastic Film Rolls.
sentences.chinese: 迪柯的装载机易于抬起和输出塑料菲林胶片。

sentences.english: ' he said, raising his head from the arm of the great chair, in which he reclined.
sentences.chinese: 他说，从他靠着的大椅子扶手上抬起头来。

sentences.english: It was; she lifted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 是的，重复了，她抬起头来笑了。

sentences.english: Lift brake lever for running out and lowering.
sentences.chinese: 抬起重锤使艇倒出并下放。

sentences.english: She looked up guiltily as I came in.
sentences.chinese: 我进来时，她内疚地抬起了头。

sentences.english: Turn up your head, look at the spider on the small corner of the ceiling in your house.
sentences.chinese: 抬起头，看看那只在你家天花板上小小角落的蜘蛛。

sentences.english: He looked up at the statue, then at Hiro.
sentences.chinese: 他抬起头看了看雕像，再转向希罗。

sentences.english: Raise your lower eyelids if you can.
sentences.chinese: 抬起你的下眼睑，如果你可以的话。

sentences.english: The man looked up. The dog was still watching him.
sentences.chinese: 他无奈地抬起头，看见狗正看着他。

sentences.english: And then he looked up,first at Rilla and then at Kiah.
sentences.chinese: 之后他抬起头看看瑞拉又看看凯。

sentences.english: Melinda and Steve looked up fearfully when Veach walked in.
sentences.chinese: 维克走进屋时，梅林达和史蒂夫惊恐地抬起头来。

sentences.english: Hurry!” Langdon glanced up, feeling himself emerge from a schooling thought.
sentences.chinese: 兰登抬起头，觉得自己从学校记忆中回到了现实。

definition: to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to raise one's head/to perk up
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
